DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Finding Corrected QT Interval Outcome Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical study that are related to QTc results as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Finding Corrected QT Interval Outcome Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The result of a lab test to measure an attribute or to determine the presence, absence or degree of a condition._The time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle as corrected with a non-specified correction formula._The result of an action._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The result of a lab test to measure an attribute or to determine the presence, absence or degree of a condition.

Concepts.definition: The result of a lab test to measure an attribute or to determine the presence, absence or degree of a condition.

Property.preferredName: Corrected QT Interval Outcome Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle as corrected with a non-specified correction formula.:The result of an action.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle as corrected with a non-specified correction formula.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have normal QTc
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have normal QTc of less than or equal to 470 msec (based on average of screening triplicates)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a QT interval corrected by Fridericia's formula (QTcF) of less than or equal to 450 msec?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a QT interval corrected for heart rate using the Bazett's formula QTcB greater than or equal to 480 msec on screening ECG?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a mean resting corrected QTc interval using the Fridericia formula (QTcF) of greater than 450 msec/male and greater than 470 msec/female (as calculated per institutional standards) obtained from 3 electrocardiograms (ECGs) 2-5 minutes apart at study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a mean QT interval corrected for heart rate using Frederica's formula (QTcF) greater than or equal to 470 ms calculated from 3 electrocardiograms (ECGs) (within 15 minutes at 5 minutes apart)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a prolonged rate-corrected QT (QTc) interval greater than or equal to 500 msec, calculated according to institutional guidelines?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a mean resting corrected QT interval (QTc using Fredericia's formula [QTcF]) greater than 470 msec (Fridericia's Criteria for Corrected QT interval [QTc]?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a mean QT interval corrected for heart rate (QTc) greater than or equal to 470 ms using Fridericia's Correction?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have mean QT interval corrected for heart rate (QTc) greater than or equal to 470 ms calculated from electrocardiograms (ECGs) using Fridericia's Correction?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a corrected QT interval calculated by the Fridericia formula (QTcF) greater than 500 msec by electrocardiogram (EKG) within 28 days before the first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a marked baseline prolongation of QT/QTc (repeated demonstration of a QTc interval of greater than 480 ms) CTCAE grade 1, using Frederica's Correction formula?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a mean resting corrected QT interval (QTc) of greater than or equal to 480 msec at study entry, as calculated by the Frederica formula (QTcF) by institutional standards obtained from an electrocardiogram (ECG) or congenital long QT syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a mean QT interval corrected for heart rate (QTc) of less than 470 ms using Fridericia's Correction?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a resting corrected QTc interval using the Fridericia formula (QTcF) less than or equal to 480 msec (as calculated per institutional standards) obtained from an ECG?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a corrected QT interval calculated by the Fridericia formula (QTcF) greater than 500 ms within 28 days before treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have cardiac function by QTcF less than or equal to 480 msec?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have corrected QT (QTc) interval greater than or equal to 470 msec?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a corrected QT interval (QTc) prolongation to >470 ms (females) or >450 ms (males) based on average of the screening triplicate 12-lead ECG?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is QT interval by Fridericia (QTcF) less than 450 ms (machine or manual read allowed)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a QTcF less than 450 msec?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a QTcF greater than 480 ms?

DataElement.changeDescription: 2020-7-27 AQT added for protocol 10389. AK 6/12/17 tt, 10076; approved/released.
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.5.3 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002390. ak 8/4/2022: fixed the box symbol in AQT_wz
